page.title: 01DUNBAR - A PROFILE
page.content: Dunbar is a small coastal town at the mouth of the Firth of Forth, situated at the eastern end of the Southern Uplands Fault.The town combined several functions:- {Defensive and Trading Site}based on its Castle and harbour.It was set up as a trading port to replace Berwick, captured by the English in 1296. { {Fishing Port }with a well-protected harbour. Fishing has declined because of competition from other ports. {Tourist Centre}based on its reputation as the{sunniest town in Scotland.} Declining with changing holiday trends {Recreation Centre}with 2 golf courses, Country Park and is close to beaches, forests and hills. {Industry}with 3 major local employers - A.P.C.M.(Cement), the S.S.E.B.'s AGR power station under construction at Torness,and Belhaven Brewery.
